code:
defmodule Solution do
  @spec maximum_sum_of_heights(max_heights :: [integer]) :: integer
  def maximum_sum_of_heights(max_heights) do
    # Find the maximum height in the array to determine the peak of the mountain
    peak_height = Enum.max(max_heights)
    
    peak_index = Enum.find_index(max_heights, &(&1 == peak_height))
    
    # Calculate the maximum sum by building up to the peak from both sides
    left_sum = calculate_side_sum(Enum.slice(max_heights, 0, peak_index + 1))
    right_sum = calculate_side_sum(Enum.reverse(Enum.slice(max_heights, peak_index, length(max_heights))))
    
    # Combine the sums of both sides, subtracting the peak to avoid double counting
    left_sum + right_sum - peak_height
  end

  defp calculate_side_sum(heights) do
    Enum.reduce(heights, {0, 0}, fn height, {prev_height, sum} -> 
      new_height = min(height, prev_height + 1)
      {new_height, sum + new_height}
    end)
    |> elem(1)
  end
end
